intro: Angelica oreoselinum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbel-like clusters, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. Angelica oreoselinum is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
